Articles.Content:
Ã¢â‚¬â€¹KSP 1.0

I have a felling that new version has more, more lags than 0.90. Lags are every few seconds. All settings are setted for minimal. I haven't so good hardware, but previous version works... better. I thought that optimisation is one of the more important things that devs work

Intel i7 M640

NVS 3100m
Please see the support stickies, we need your logs to determine anything

Ah, sorry. Here is output_log

https://www.dropbox.com/s/x5nyhllttch75m4/output_log.txt?dl=0

I don't see a cause but there is a lot of log activity, you could try starting KSP with " -nolog" to see if it helps.

You can add the line to a shortcut properties or to the Steam custom launch box.

Well, it seem that is the same. But I have important information: lags are regular:

1 second is normal, 1 second are lags, 1 second is normal, 1 second are lags...

Sometimes time of normal playing is longer, but generally lags are always with 1 second delay.
Oh, are you seeing the clock turn yellow? There's a setting called delta time, if you lower that to about 0.3 it should help.
Well, I think it is a bit better. The clock is yellow when I look at the ship (from last scenario after decouple from station) and the planet behind him. Otherwise it is green and there is no lag.
I get yellow a lot, it's how the game swaps judder for a slightly slower but smooth game, it used to be a community fix called lagsbane that was added to stock around .18

I'm getting the same thing since the update - whilst they're not every few seconds, they're every 5 minutes or so and happen for around 20-30 seconds (but the game then does continue).

www.bassettmatthew.webspace.virginmedia.com/output_log.zip

Yes, something has been definitely broken with optimization . I hope the developers will fix it soon

Edited July 4, 2017 by Inversion
No, your English seems to be fine.
